FuncDef:
The adm card connect-to-interface command configures connections between the channels and optical fiber interfaces on an Add/Drop Multiplexer (ADM).
The undo adm card connect-to-interface command restores the default configuration.
By default, no connection between an ADM channel and an optical fiber interface is configured.
CLIs: undo adm slot <soltid> card <card-id> channel <channel-id> connect-to-interface

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an available subcard.
-

Specifies the ID of an available channel.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 8.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] adm slot 1 card 0 channel 1 connect-to-interface GigabitEthernet 3/0/0
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To manage an ADM on the NMS, run the adm card connect-to-interface command to configure connections between the channels and optical fiber interfaces. The connections are drawn on the NMS, which facilitates user management.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
